Common name: Southern Grass Skink  
*Pseudemoia entrecasteauxii* is a species of skink endemic to southern Australia. They prefer forest area and grassland habitats, and usually seen around fallen timber or leaf litter (Cogger, 2014).  
They are viviparous.
